WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A fish in its mouth and in the other mouth is half a beggar (the head is cut off). The other half is on the ground. The animal that has fishes and beggars in its mouth, is an alligator.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Just imagine the blood  and fishes and beggars everywhere. The alligator is having a good meal tonight.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The reading is the same as the わに in "Wanikani." Ever heard of it?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: So long as you've ever used WaniKani, you probably know the reading of the word alligator.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: when the fish (魚) reaches the one with two mouths (咢) he realizes it's an alligator

鰐字的基本解释

鰐
è
见“鳄”。

鰐字的汉语字典释义

[①]［è］
［《廣韻》五各切，入鐸，疑。］
“鳄1”的繁体字。亦作“鱷1”。
鳄鱼。

鰐字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鰐； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1475第01
【廣韻】五各切【集韻】【正韻】逆各切，?音咢。?，或作鰐。魚名。似蜥蜴，出日南。【博物志】南海有鰐魚，狀如鼉，斬其頭而乾之，去齒而更生，如此者三乃止。【左思·吳都賦】?鼊鯖鰐。【註】鰐魚長二丈餘，有四足，如鼉，喙長三尺，甚利齒，虎及大鹿渡水，鰐擊之，皆中斷。【類篇】或作鱷。互詳鱷字註。

crocodile.
crocodile
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Hai Collection】【Fish Character Department】　crocodile; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: page 1475 01
[Guang Yun] Five cuts [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Reverse cuts,? Sound. ?, or as a crocodile. The name of the fish. Like a lizard, out of Nichinan. [Natural History] There are crocodiles in the South China Sea, which resemble a prickly crocodile. [Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu]? The mackerel crocodile. [Note] The crocodile is more than two feet long, has four legs, such as a 鼍, the beak is three feet long, and the teeth are very sharp. 【Classes】Or as a crocodile. вм. 鳄
Radicals: 魚, 口, 一  (fish, mouth, ground, beggar)
Meaning Mnemonic
A fish in its mouth and in the other mouth is half a beggar (the head is cut off). The other half is on the ground. The animal that has fishes and beggars in its mouth, is an alligator.
Just imagine the blood and fishes and beggars everywhere. The alligator is having a good meal tonight.
Reading Mnemonic
The reading is the same as the わに in "Wanikani." Ever heard of it?
So long as you've ever used WaniKani, you probably know the reading of the word alligator.
